rule-19-25-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 11 with a minimum outdoor airflow requirement of 100 cfm. The HVAC fan correctly operates continuously during occupied hours.

standard.rule_description: Schedules for HVAC fans that provide outdoor air for ventilation shall run continuously whenever spaces are occupied in the baseline design.

rule-19-25-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 11 with a minimum outdoor airflow requirement of 100 cfm. The HVAC fan incorrectly cycles on and off during occupied hours to maintain temperature setpoints, but not outdoor airflow requirements.

standard.rule_description: Schedules for HVAC fans that provide outdoor air for ventilation shall run continuously whenever spaces are occupied in the baseline design.

rule-19-25-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 7 with no minimum outdoor airflow requirement. The HVAC fan correctly cycles on and off during occupied hours to maintain temperature setpoints.

standard.rule_description: Schedules for HVAC fans that provide outdoor air for ventilation shall run continuously whenever spaces are occupied in the baseline design.

rule-19-25-d.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 3 with no minimum outdoor airflow requirement. The HVAC fan is set to remain off during occupied hours.

standard.rule_description: Schedules for HVAC fans that provide outdoor air for ventilation shall run continuously whenever spaces are occupied in the baseline design.
